archbishop brought together paris suite made king behalfe might returne restored good revenue arising absence likewise king favour upon humble submission king answered rest contented could allow offended last exception turned unto french king telling much hee done archbishop • ee used sayd well acquainted trickes fellow cannot hope good dealing hand see goeth delude clause saving honour god whatsoever shall displease hee alleadge prejudiciall honour almighty god say unto whereas beene king england many mee whereof peradventure greater power part farre lesse againe many archbishop man holy • able men looke duty ever performed greatest archbishop ever weakest simplest predecessours let yeeld shall abundantly content mee hereunto archbishop answered cunningly stoutly predecessours note policie auswer could bring thing passe first dash content beare many thing men fell omitted duty oft time church gotten constancie good prelate whose example would follow thus farre forth though could augment priviledges church time yet would never consent diminished answere heard men cryed shame generally imputed stirres unto king lewis offended answere asked whether thought himselfe greater pardon strength save life life come heaven straight without feeling paine purgatory came king might sea land emperour strong armie spaniard pope venetian king lewis france soon pope desired italy peace immediately french men christen men • pitty yea great sinne also shed bloud french king christian king thus peace concluded englishman rather sheep came home winter left fleece behinde wherefore • mall number sought better rayment home hanged labour peace made holy cardinal • bishop old guise calke cast 40 yea hundred year like chance unto kingdome considered emperour like chosen emperour grandfather maximilian maximilian already obtained diver electours bee considered also mighty hee bee first king spaine pertaineth thereto wont 6 7 kingdomes • duke burgaine earle flanders holland zeland braband pertaine thereto emperour brother duke austria sister queene hungarie wherefore thought prelate wee take heed betimes kingdome like troubled wee brought foot man shall mighty shall power take french king hand hand venetian pope also whatsoever pertaineth unto empire whatsoever belongeth unto kingdomes dominion thereto hee come rome crowned shall hee overlooke holy father see doth shall old heretickes rise againe say pope antichrist stirre againe bring light hid brought asleepe much cost paine bloudshedding hundred yeares long considered also aunt queene england wife king england si • ter considered old amitie betweene house burgaine old king england could never doe ought france without helpe last considered course marchandize england hath part also naturall hate englishman beare frenchman wherefore use old practise set french king shall lightly obtain favour king england meanes ant wife aidwith men mony wherefore wee must take heed betimes breake amitie thing archbishopricke canterbury hee might keepe yet receive profit likewise bishopricke winchester determined consecrated • hold election indeede space nine yeares meane time rest countryman realme much pestered growne odious well nobility common onely infinite wealth immoderate preferment much envied much pride insolency man hardly beare owne friend much lesse alien • tranger men naturally dislike much sooner owne countrimen amongst rest ethelmarus bare himselfe bold upon king brother gave commandement servant force clergy man possession benefice whereunto pretended right withstood draw possession contumelious manner poore man loath loose living defended long till lord elect men slaine himselfe people soare beaten wounded within dayes one two died fact like complained baron pope king brought poictavins hatred realme ready rise rather upon occasion anno dom 1252 certain • priest intruded himselfe authority prelate hospitall southwerke within diocesse founded thomas becket eustathius de len officiall archbishop canterbury conceiving himselfe injured hereby reason patronage consent ought intervened omitted contempt • thrice admonished said priest depart entranee injurious presumptuous priest stiled commonly prior hospitall refuseth doe keeping possession • fficiall hereupon excommunicates contumacy excommunication prior continued fortie dayes multiplying threat revilings officiall brooking pride last commanded contumacious prior apprehended hearing • enters church priestly vestment fortifieth himselfe officer purposely sent apprehend spared contemned keyes church officiall therefore commanded carried maydstone • manner archbishop untill determined done hereupon thinking keepe • ause archbishop said neare place bishop winchester hearing angry became suffer • great injury disgrace presented grievous complaint brother whose ayde councell puffed calling band souldiers together small company following sent seeke apprehend author violence therefore great • orce tumult hostile war came suwerke thinking found searching place finding none went hastily swift pace maydstone free captive prior detained powerfull hand breaking downe stood way searching secret corner found sought hee hid called fire might burne ash many injury committed found sought certified whisperer officiall sought • wit lambeth neare london ran thither troope heaving doores hinge breaking running altogether confused troope sodainely houre dinner tooke officiall premeditating thing hostile unseemely manner haling away set horse like vile slave deprehended act religion devotion piety • shall conclude saint de consider ad eugenium lib 4 bernard word vides omnem ecclesiasticum zelum fervere sola pro dignita • e tuenda honori totum datur sanctitati nihil aut parum nisi quod sublime est hoc salutare dicamus quod gloriam redolet id justum ita omne humile probro ducitur inter palatinatos et tunc potissimum volunt dominari cum professi fuerint servitutem fideles se spondent ut opportunius fidentibus noceant ante omnia sapientes sunt ut facia • mala b • num autem facere nesciunt hi invisi terrae coe • utrique injecêre manus impii deum temerarii sanctum seditiosi invicem aemuli vicinos inhumani extraneos quos neminem amantes amat nemo hi sunt qui subesse non sustinent praeesse non norunt superioribus infideles inferioribus importabiles docuerunt linguam suam grandia loqui cum operentur exigua blandissimi adulatores mordacissimi detractores simplicissimi dissimulatores malignissimi proditores miserandam sponsam talibus creditam paranymphis qui assignata cultui ejus proprio retinere quaestui non verentur non amici profectò sponsi sed aemuli sunt erunt inquam hujusmodi maximo studio corrigendi ne pereant aut ne perimant coercendi chap vii cum universi christi jugo subjecti ad sedem apostolicam patrocinium invenire debeant favorem illos tamen specialius conv • nit munim • ne protectionis confoveri quorum fidem ac devotionem pluribus est experta ut ad ipsius electionis favorem tanto amplius provocetur ejus reverentiae devotiori affectione subdantur quanto benevolentiae ipsius gratiae pignus se noverint certius assecutos e • propter charissime christo fili reverentiam ac devotionem quam ad romanam te habuisse longis retro temporibus ecclesiam novimus attendentes praesentis scripti pagina duximus statuendum ut scoticana ecclesia apostolicae sedi cujus filia specialis existit nullo mediante debeat subjacere qua hae sedes episcopales esse noscuntur ecclesiae videlicet andreae glascuensis dunkeldensis dumblinensis brehinensis aberdonensis moraviensis rosensensis katinensis nemini liceat nisi romano pontifici vel legato ab ipsius latere destinato regnum scotiae interdicti vel excommunicationis sententiam promulgare si promulgata fuerit decernimus non valere adjicimus ut nulli de caetero qui de regno sco • iae non fuerit nisi quem apostolica sedes propter hoc de corpore suo specialiter destinaverit licitum sit eo ligationis officium exercere prohibemus autem ut controversiae quae fuerint regno illo de possessionibus ejus exortae ad examen extra regnum positorum judicum non trabantur nisi ad romanam ecclesiam fuerit appellatum si qua vero scripta contra hujus libertatis statuta apparuerint impetrata vel posterum istius concessionis mentione non habita contigerit impetrari nullum tibi vel ipsi regno circa hujus praerogativae concessionem praejudicium generetur • praeterea libertates immunitates tibi vel eidem regno vel ecclesiis eo constitutis praedecessoribus nostris romani pontificibus indultas hactenus observatas ratas habemus illibatas futuris temporibus statuimus permanere nulli ergo hominum liceat paginam nostrae constitutionis prohibitionis infringere vel ei aliquatenus contraire si quis autem hoc attentare praesumpserit indignationem omnipotentis dei beatorum petri pauli apostolorum ejus se noverit incursurum datum laterani tertia idus martii pontificatus nostri anno primo long metropolitane bishop consecra • ed whereupon pope erected church saint andrewes archbishopricke time king iames third touching thus writeth lesleus li 8 p 317 hoc anno yeare christ 1474 patricius grahamus sedis andreapolitanae ecclesiae episcopus crebris literis ac nuntiis papa efflagitavit ut metropolitana potestas divi andreae civitate figeretur iniquum esse enim contendit ut scoti ab eboracensi episcopo tanquam primate penderent cum propter crebra bella quibus se scoti angli mutuo lacessunt scotis ad illum non pateretur tutu accessus nec liberum jus praesertim appellationibus writ certaine men gave judgement thing mighty strongest upon earth first sayd wine strong thing second sayd king strongest third sayd woman yet strength thing truth beareth away victory may say unto height tyranny spirituall sorcerer growne priest england mightier either wine king queene lord woman besides agreeth example christ fled away people would made king temporall governour christ refused write thus septem stellae angeli sunt septem ecclesiarum nec putandum est quod hoc loco angeli singuli singulis deputentur hominibus quod incongrue ab aliquibus aestimatur sed potius angeli eccles hic intelligendi sunt rectores populi qui singulis ecclesiis praesidentes verbum vitae cunctis annunciant nam angeli nomen nuncius interpretatum dicitur et angelo ecclesiae ephesi scribe darivo hic casu angelo posuit non genitivo ac si diceret scribe angelo huic ecclesiae ut non tam angelum ecclesiam separatim videatur dixisse quam quis angelus exponere voluisset unam videlicet faciens angeli ecclesiaeque personam quamvi • enim sacramenti dispensatione praeponatur compaginis tamen unitate connectitur nam hanc regulam principio servans non septem angelis sed septem ecclesiis scripsisset iohannes inquiens septem ecclesiis quae sunt asia dominus quem vidit scribe inquit libro quae vidisti mitte septem ecclesiis postea tamen angelis jubet scribi ut ostenderet unum esse sed etiam siqua
